t: A Song of degrees of David.
Lord,*sp my heart is not haughty, nor mine eyes lofty: neither do I exercise myself in great matters, or in things too high for me.
Surely*p I have behaved and quieted myself, as a child that is weaned of his mother: my soul is even as a weaned child.
Let*p Israel hope in the Lord*s from henceforth and for ever.
